questions_and_answers.question: If you encounter a victim of electric shock, what is the first action you should take?
options: A. Begin CPR immediately
B. Switch off the current or remove the victim from contact with the live conductor using dry non-conducting materials
C. Immediately apply first aid to any burns the victim may have
D. Give the victim water to drink
E. Move the victim to a more comfortable position
questions_and_answers.correct_answer: B. Switch off the current or remove the victim from contact with the live conductor using dry non-conducting materials
B. Touch the person to check their pulse
C. Switch off the power or remove the source of contact
D. Give them water to drink
C. Switch off the power or remove the source of contact
D. Give them water to drink

question: What is the recommended immediate first aid measure for severe bleeding?
options: A. Sew the wound closed
B. Use a hot iron to cauterize the wound
C. Apply a clean dressing without applying pressure
D. Apply pressure on the wound
E. Cleanse the wound with strong alcohol
correct_answer: D. Apply pressure on the wound
question: In the case of severe bleeding, what is the immediate action you should take?
options: A. Make the patient sit up
B. Apply ice to the wound
C. Make the patient lie down and rest
D. Leave the patient alone until help arrives
correct_answer: C. Make the patient lie down and rest

question: What should be your immediate course of action if someone experiences an electric shock?
options: A. Apply first aid to the burns right away.
B. Push the person away from the electrical current.
C. Leave the scene to search for professional help.
D. Remove the victim from the live conductor, if possible, using dry non-conducting materials.
E. Immediately start treating for shock.
correct_answer: D. Remove the victim from the live conductor, if possible, using dry non-conducting materials.
question: What is the first step you should take when providing first aid to a person who has suffered an electric shock?
It is safe to give an unconscious person something to eat or drink if they are breathing normally.
options: A. Start artificial respiration immediately
B. Call for medical assistance
C. Disconnect the power source or remove the victim from contact with the live conductor
D. Apply ice to any burns
correct_answer: C. Disconnect the power source or remove the victim from contact with the live conductor
